edu.cmu.sei.arche.corebridge.interactions
Class ScenarioInteractions

java.lang.Object
  edu.cmu.sei.arche.corebridge.interactions.Interactions
      edu.cmu.sei.arche.corebridge.interactions.ScenarioInteractions
public class ScenarioInteractions
extends Interactions

All interactions with the ArchE Core related to the "scenario" architectural element.

Author:
Henry Chen, Neel Mullick

Method Detail

assertScenario

public void assertScenario(jess.Rete engineArchE,
                           java.lang.String[] scenario,
                           java.lang.String stateScenario)
Asserts a scenario fact in the ArchE Core with state = "final" / "notfinal" so that the scenario is either persisted or processes (thought about!) by the ArchE Core.

Parameters:
engineArchE - The centrally located Rete object using which the fact is asserted.
scenario - The string arrays of all the contents of a scenario.
stateScenario - The string that indicates whether the user is "thinking" (i.e. asking the core to think and advise on the scenario) or is saving the final version of the scenario. This will be "final" if the user is finalizing the scenario - any other value for this parameter will be treated as a scenario to think about.

thinkScenario

public java.lang.String[] thinkScenario(jess.Rete engineArchE)
This method locates the temporary fact that Asserts a scenario fact in the ArchE Core with state != "final" so that the ArchE Core can process the scenario and give the user suggestions / modifications to the scenario. The assumption for this implementation is that at any given time there is only one instance of the C_AddScenario fact in the Core. After this "think-like" processing this instance will be retracted from the Core.

Parameters:
engineArchE - The centrally located Rete object using which the fact is asserted.

modifyScenario

public void modifyScenario(jess.Rete engineArchE,
                           java.lang.String[] scenario,
                           int applyToSlotM)
Modifies a scenario fact in the ArchE Core. Even though the findFactByFact method exposed by the Rete class is faster than findFactByID (as documented in the API documentation) we have changed the implementation to use the latter because the former implies complete knowledge of the fact structures in the Arche Core. Using the latter allows for modifiability over performance - becasuse the fact structures can change without "finding the fact in the core bridge" ever becoming a problem.

Parameters:
engineArchE - The centrally located Rete object using which the fact is retracted.
scenario - The string arrays of all the contents of a modified scenario.
applyToSlotM - The Scenario Fact Id which is to be modified.

retractScenario

public void retractScenario(jess.Rete engineArchE,
                            int applyToSlotD)
Retracts the following - the Scenario Fact and the responsibility mappings of the scenario from the ArchE Core.

Parameters:
engineArchE - The centrally located Rete object using which the fact is retracted.
applyToSlotD - the fact Id of the Scenario that is to be deleted.
